reasoning: New feature with database table creation and multiple UI components. Contains to single service with 10-15 estimated files. All patterns exist in codebase (recipes CRUD, community tags/search). No external integrations or unfamiliar technologies.

scope.notes: Database migration, 3-4 API routes, 6-8 frontend components, hooks, store, and types. Integration point with Shot Creator but contained scope.

integrations.notes: Uses existing Supabase database. May use shadcn/ui components for tag input and search. No external APIs or unfamiliar libraries.

infrastructure.notes: New user_prompts table in existing Supabase database. No new environment variables or Docker containers needed.

knowledge.notes: Codebase has similar patterns: recipes API (/api/v1/recipes), community items with search/tags, Zustand stores, shadcn/ui forms. Feature structure follows existing conventions.

concerns: Search performance with hundreds of prompts
Tag system design (separate table vs JSON column)
Folder hierarchy depth and navigation UX
Shot Creator integration must preserve existing workflow
risk.notes: Self-contained feature with minimal risk to existing functionality. Main concerns are UX performance for power users and clean integration with Shot Creator.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Database changes and user data handling require thorough testing. Unit tests for API logic and search filtering. Integration tests for full CRUD flows and Shot Creator integration. No auth/payment changes so security scan not required.
